snippet: The purely electric hatchback was named the greenest car of the year by the American Council for an Energy-Efficient Economy, depriving the Civic Natural Gas of a ninth consecutive year atop the list.
abstract: The purely electric hatchback was named the greenest car of the year by the American Council for an Energy-Efficient Economy, depriving the Civic Natural Gas of a ninth consecutive year atop the list.
lead_paragraph: The 2012 Honda Civic Natural Gas may have been named Green Car of the Year at the L.A. auto show in November, but the CNG-burner settled for second in Washington, where the American Council for an Energy-Efficient Economy, a lobby group, chose the Mitsubishi i as its greenest vehicle of the year. It was the first time a purely electric vehicle had topped the list in 12 years, and the first time in the last eight years that the CNG Civic was deprived the honor. Read more »

headline.main: Courtesy of Mitsubishi i, Honda Loses Top Spot on Annual List of Green Cars

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: American Council for an Energy-Efficient Economy
